description:
Best pizza take-out joint in the North Beach area. I can say that because I live literally steps away from Nizario's and their pizza beats out all the other competition in the neighborhood. 

The guys who work here are very friendly too. Sometimes they ask me how my day is going and etc. 

Be sure to pay them a visit!
author: Philip M.

description:
Ordered a slice
$3.75
Fresh!
Toasty (passed through an oven again)
Awesomely, friendly service 
I have to pass by every time I come to visit San Francisco
author: Tanya C.

description: It was super good omg. I was actually super surprised, but glad I went in and got some
author: Angel H.

description: These guys.. are awesome. The man in the light colored shirt leveled with my when I told him that I'm vegan. He kinda laughed at first, but respect is earned, right? I told him that I've been craving handmade pizza and seeing the whole process made me hungry, especially after seeing a friend walk out of the place very satisfied. Ultimately, he took the time to listen to me and discuss the ingredients with me. I gave him my money, and he gave me a customized handmade pizza pie with olive oil, oregano, extra tomatoes, onions, mushrooms, and bell peppers. Let me tell ya... I'm gonna be coming here at least once every couple of weeks to get my pizza fix. The service alone made this 5-star review. The environment, the speed, the presentation and the flavors: truly invaluable.
author: Manuel R.

description: I took 2 slices (pepperoni and one mixed pork and pepperoni) and it's really good. A little dry. I don't like when dough is thick but there, it's quite good.
author: Marie-Claire L.

description: I got a take out Nazirios special last Saturday.  It was so good.  I enjoyed it so did my wife.  The cheese is perfect and the toppings are tasty.  Absolutely yummy.  I will be coming here again.  The root beer is great too.  They have great customer service and that sauce is so good.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
So delicious. Pepperoni and sausage pizza is a hit!!!! 
Recommend this place
Walking down San Francisco and craving pizza this is the spot, the workers are so kind and well service
author: Jazmin C.

description:
This place is pretty convenient to grab a slice of pizza if you're ever in a hurry or suffering from a bad case of the drunchies. 

The dining area is a bit run-down, with an okay amount of seating for the size of the place. The place seems a little dingy, but also expected. I've dined in a couple times. Most times, I've just taken my pizza to go. The lines can get fairly long in the after-hours, but other times, there isn't much of a wait.

The pizza is good, but not the best. The crust is average and I don't have anything in particular to say about the toppings. It's a pretty average slice of pizza. I enjoy the Nizario's Special (pepperoni, mushrooms, red onion,  green bell peppers) and the California Special (pepperoni, sausage, Canadian bacon, black olives, feta cheese). 

Overall, I don't have anything bad to say about this place. I would most likely come back if I am ever craving pizza at a late hour or just need something quick and convenient.
author: Meghan J.

description: The pizza is probably only 4 stars but the guys behind the counter are really nice. Always a comfortable spot to sober up before driving
author: Mark P.

description: Late night eatery! Yummy thick crust pizza. Love it. The employees are pretty great too. Great locations in the city.
author: Erica M.

description: Terrible pizza. Plastic cheese and thick crust. Wish I could get a refund. Avoid if you can.
author: Nipur D.

description:
Cheese pizza and I understand each other well. 

Cheese pizza knows that they are my favorite, and in return the well balanced sauce, light on the cheese, not greasy, crust is perfection makes this my favorite late night spot. 

I've tried a few around town and when a Nizario's is in reach you bet I won't be going anywhere else.

#latenightnoms
author: Shereen A.

description:
Literally the worst pizza I've ever had bar none.  I don't use the word worst lightly since I know full well there can only be one "worst" and I say unreservedly this pizza is it.  Tiny dried up sad pepperoni, nasty tasting barely seasoned crust, terrible sauce, minimal cheese...it's almost an art form how bad this pizza was.  Like they're the Michelangelo of bad pizza and this is the Sistine chapel of nasty awful Italian travesty.  

 Beyond that the place looks gross and rundown, the soda tasted nearly flat which means it was probably stored poorly and lost carbonation.  Insult to injury.  

Remember that old adage "pizza is like sex, even when it's bad it's still good"?  This place was like the pizza equivalent of being with a person made of sandpaper and waking up with crabs.  It singlehandedly proves that adage wrong in the worst way.  Congratulations on ruining pizza Nizaris, I didn't think it was possible and now I know indeed it is.
author: Ed C.

description: Great pizza! Had a chat with the owner and we talked about all the people that come through their shop. It's great to meet locals and hear about their story. They are very fast and have great customer service. These people are working hard and doing a great job!
author: Cameron R.

description: always my late night snack that never is disappointing to me.. . I am just happy that I can eat after a few, or should I say many, many adult beverages.
author: Zen W.

description:
I don't care what anyone else tells you.

Please do yourself a favor and go grab a slice of pie here!

With a little(or a lot) to drink or responsible and sober:
Pick any darn slice with your card or cash ready and enjoy!!!

This is by far my favorite pizza joint in the States!
I've had everything from cheese, to their misc. toppings and good lord, every time I bite into a slice it's been a crisp crust, hot gooey oozey cheese, and their tomato sauce is a perfect balance of tangy and savory!

Why are you still reading this?

Go and and grab a slice already!
author: Eileen M.

description: Not a bad slice of pizza for the price would definitely recommend stopping and trying it for $4.50 is not bad at all meat lovers slice
author: Rodney S.

description: A good slice of pie when you need it. Quick service and good quality. Would go again. Just wish there were more options when I was there. But I got a delicious slice of pepperoni and sausage.
author: Raimond Christopher G.

description: Pizza is delicious! Got the cheese and pesto chicken slices.  I'm very impressed with the quality of the cheese and thickness of their slices.  I would have given them full 5 stars but the slices are a bit pricey for what I am used to.
author: Richard C.

description:
I came to this shop on Vacation and got two slices of cheese pizza. It was a great quick meal while exploring San Fransisco. 

Note: would come again if I ever go back to San Francisco!
author: Nick G.

description: Definitely have great food love it the pizza is amazing oh man you've got to come here if you get a chance.
author: Darius D.

description: We had the Garlic Chicken Special and it has garlic, chicken and pesto. It was good but I wish they didn't put so much pesto into the pizza.
author: Alice X.

description: Wowwww once again my girlfriends did not let me down.  They have been raving about this place for a while.  Me my kids were out in the city, went to Nizarios and it was amazing.  The Philly was perfect.  American cheese.    My kids had cheese slices they loved it.  Quick service goooood food.  I am coming back for sure when I come up to the city.
author: Maria M.

description: This place is a great no-frills counter with a thick slice of pizza. Each bite is a mouthful of warm, cheesy bliss.  It's relatively cheap for the neighborhood. It's a little dirty-and always seems empty, but..again, no frills. Good pizza is messy. Be happy with good pizza.
author: Steve A.

description: Nizario's is a solid pizza spot when you're in a hurry or don't have the patience to wait in line at Golden Boy's .  Located at the border of North Beach, Nizario's pizza has more of a crisp crust and a chewier and soft center.  Definitely not a cooking style for everyone, but I personally enjoy when the pizza is cooked this way.  Pricing isn't bad and the guys who run the place are nice.  Not to mention this place is open till 3am on the weekends.  Definitely worth a try.
author: Josh S.

description:
Perfect for those late night outings with your friends!

Nizario's Pizza is located in North Beach which is perfect if you're feeling a little (or very) hungry after a few drinks. I'm not ashamed to say I finished a whole pizza with just one other person. 

The service is really cheerful and lively even during Halloween night, which meant mobs of slightly drunk people dressed in eclectic clothing. The line goes by decently fast even if there is wait. They have pizza slices ready for order and whole pizzas ready in about 10 minutes. The interior has plenty of room and decent seating as I never felt cramped. 

I was starving so the pizza was extra delicious! I ordered a whole meat lovers' pizza to split with my friend. A freshly baked pizza is a wondrous thing. Nizario's has a soft crust, melty cheese, and delicious toppings! The only suggestion I might make would be to add a water dispenser near the counter. Although, I assume they just want you to buy a bottle of water from the front. 

All in all a great experience. 
-Open late
-Awesome pizza
-Good service
-Spacious interior
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Is what it is...out bar hopping in SF for a night, get hungry, need food, eat pizza.  Decent $4 slice. Was hot, good veggies. and ready pretty quick.

No complains.  Chow down ya' drunks!
author: Scott Z.

description: SCAM ALERT!! The late night employees and corrupt security guard at this location think everyone is too drunk to count their change. They messed with the wrong guy; I'm extremely allergic to alcohol. I ordered 2 slices which were $3.50 each. I hand the cashier a $20 and he rings up $17 for no apparent reason and gives me $2 change.  Please see my Ripoff report and respond if you have been scammed here as well: http://www.ripoffreport.com/r/nizarios-pizza/san-francisco-california-94133/nizarios-pizza-nizarios-pizza-279-columbus-ave-san-francisco-employee-theft-and-scam-1231224
author: Ben A.

description:
I usually eat a lot here because its the closest pizza place to my house .


Pizza is good however it would be perfect if they make the dough thinner .


Thank u !
author: Jay M.

description: This was decent pizza. For a weeknight while I was traveling in SF, it did the job. Nothing fantastic, but not horrible.
author: Asim V.

description:
For delivery only - they did not accommodate on a Sunday evening around 9pm.  The man on the phone said "We are too busy and you are too far away."  We are 0.9 miles from them, a 5 minute drive - that is ridiculous.

They lost our business forever.
author: Lisa G.

description:
I walk by Nizario's everyday on my way to work and never found the time to stop in.  I assumed that the place was only decent as it relied upon the tourists walking up and down Columbus.  I think I was wrong.  

The pizza is pretty tasty and filling compared to other places in the FIDI.  It was quick, hot, and reasonably priced.  Also, as others have mentioned, it's nice touch having the tax all rolled into the price - I hate carrying spare change.

Finally, having worked in the food service industry before, I know customer services is always hard to find.  The gentlemen that took my order was genuinely cordial and pleasant to speak to.  Hopefully the owner gives this guy some time off as he deserves it.

Chalk it up as another tasty spot in the city.
author: Michael O.

description:
Perfect location for a pizza joint after a night out on Broadway. Came here with my friends after Sutra to get some food since everything else up the street had waits. Given it was 3 girls and one guy, the workers treated us pretty nicely. Ordered a whole pizza at a decent price; we paid a little more to get a half & half.

They do have a security guard but beware of drunk belligerents inside the restaurant and out. Bathroom is for customers only I believe. I probably would have never stepped foot inside this place, but it was a great lifesaver that night.

- Jenn
author: Jenn Y.

description:
Their pizza slices are huge!  Besides that point, there's nothing really commendable about their pizza style!  Crust, toppings, flavoring and dough is pretty much standard.

They have a simple menu and serve pizzas within the affordable price range!  The dining area is pretty small and narrow, but be mindful that this place isn't catered to the dining experience with waiters at hand!

Convenient location that is on the corner and on the edge of North Beach!  If you're feeling like pizza during the late night hours and you're on Broadway street, this place is the spot to hit up!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Dranky drank and getting my grub on @ Nizarios
3am & open fresh slice pizza....
author: Linda B.

description: I'm glad my crew stumbled into this place after a day full of drinking.  The pizza definitely helped sober us up before having to make the long trip back down to San Jose.  Luckily for us, one our group members didn't drink.  Maybe I'm a bit biased when it comes to pizza places, but I really can't tell the difference between "good" and "bad" pizza.  I still love my Dominoe's/Pizza Hut/Papa John's from my days of ordering delivery pizza.
author: Richard L.

description:
Even 3am drunkenness couldn't make this pizza better.   We had two 12" pizzas to share..
1. Cheese with jalapenos, mushrooms, pepperoi
2. Vegetarian special with extra Canadian bacon

The crust was soggy and doughy, and the toppings were pretty generic and unremarkable.  Parmesan and red pepper flakes helped.  Maybe it's better when ordered by the slice?
author: Marilyn T.

description:
Ate there be we were desperate for a quick bite in the area. Terrible pizza (unless you enjoy flavors of cardboard) and shi*ty service. 

When asking for a cup of water after purchasing slices for 4 adults I was told "we don't have cups" after telling them that was ridiculous they said
 "bi+ch, this is San Francisco we are in a drought." Cool. So cool. 

Never again.
author: Magen F.

description: As a vegetarian it's hard to fine places that care about your beliefs. I'm not a vegan,but I will not eat cheese that contains animal enzymes. Nizarios were not sure about what soure of enzymes were in their cheese,but they made sure that they made me something that was delicious and vegetarian friendly.  Bravo, in the 23 years of being vegetarian,  I never had that kind of serve, btw, the vegan pizza they made for me was fantastic!
author: Kimberly A.

description: It's sturdy and m a little tipsy! The pizza was fast the people were sugar sweet and I'm in love! There s tree more stores in the rainbow city? Yasssss I'm coming Nizario's! Can I meet Nizario's? Oh ma gawd I'm ready!!!!! Best chain in the cityyyyy
author: Devin A.

description: Awesome pizza! Great service, too. I was on my way to eat dinner at an Italian restaurant. The smell of their pizza brought me in for a piece. Then I had to get another... Top-notch experience!
author: Aaron G.

description:
Parking is non-existent but most likely you are searching for a place to eat as you're walking around North Beach.

Positives: Friendly service, open later than most places usually (not holidays) and the pizza has flavor to it

Negatives: Pizza was cold
author: Jonah H.

description:
We ordered Nizario's on two separate occasions for events at the office. The pizzas were quite good and very affordable. Also, if you order enough, they are very generous with discounts. 

Will definitely order from Nizario's again.
author: Kevin L.

description: the pizza by the slice was good...not exactly a big slice so i finished it before i could snap a picture. would of gave 4 star not expecting much from a late night pizza joint. its not exactly comfortable to dine-in kind of dingy and bit dirty.
author: Aaron A.

description: Hella good.....on the the spot...smacking pizza very good, good vibes...good people they care
author: Mac M.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

1/1 Star: I walked here at night. No wait. 

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

0/1 Star: fast food style. Questionable cleanness. 

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

2/3 Stars: a pizza takes 8 minutes to bake. Meat lovers is delicious when it's hot out of the oven. 

_____

Overall Experience

3/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words

Dirty bathroom
author: Elliott N.

description: First pizza in San Francisco and I have to say I have never had a pizza this god dam good!!! I had a California slice every night I was here but then again I didn't try any other pizza places so if there is something better than this.........
author: Kevin D.

description:
Of course everywhere is closed on new years and yet I get to run into this dope local pizza place and me oh my I found myself a spot 
That was One of the greatest pizzas I've ever had and that could be bc I got it extra cooked but either way it was bombbbbbb

Happy New Years
author: Zeenna K.

description:
3.5 stars.

Conveniently located on the edge of Chinatown, North Beach and Broadway Nizario's third San Francisco location offers tasty pizza slices for those times when you just want to grab a seat somewhere and have a quick bite.  This corner stop just steps from the City Lights bookstore on Columbus Avenue features a nice roomy dining room, a big television projecting some of your favorite prime time programs and most importantly quality, fresh-made pizza that you can order by the whole or by the slice.

The staff is very friendly.  I just happened to be in the neighborhood about a week after the restaurant had opened and decided to drop in for a slice and a soft drink.  I had a combo slice with pepperoni, salami and mushrooms.  The medium crust pizza was nice and chewy with a nice crispy bottom.  The sauce wasn't very distinct however.  There was an average amount of cheese, but the toppings were piled high.  All in all it was a pretty satisfying snack for under five bucks.  I know I'll be back!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: Late night pizza is the best when your in north beach. Is this my favorite spot in sf?? Currently yes but I've been to only 5/6 other Italian pizza joints and I'm a bit picky. Looking for quality pie with traditional red sauce and locally sourced ingredients . Not a huge store front so i recommend grabbing this pizza to go and taking it and some beers home. Enjoy whatever you think looks interesting on the menu and post about it, place deserves to get more reviews and high on Yelp
author: John R.

description:
Pricing structure on the slices kept super simple for the drunkies - 3 bucks for cheese, 3.50 for one topping, 4 bucks for any kind of combo, with sales tax rolled into the price. That's about as reasonable as slice prices get in San Francisco touristy areas.

Good size but kinda bready and as others have noted, they're really sparing on the sauce, which I guess is their thing. Maybe another drunkie move, more bread to absorb alcohol, less red sauce to spew up and stain stuff. 

It's ehh. It's hard to screw up pizza and they don't, but as I was expecting for Broadway & Columbus it's pretty Meh. At least the price is OK. If you get a fresh pie made and delivered maybe it's better?
author: Jeremy H.

description: I ordered their half meat combo and half garlic pesto chicken and it was pretty good. I felt like it had enough sauce and was extra cheese I ordered a large and it was a nice sized portion too. I will deff order more in the future.
author: Rene L.

description:
12.9.11: Have you ever had the greatest late night pizza in the world when you're full of alcohol? Well this is the place to try their pizza, what's so great about this place is that they let you put as much herbs as you want on it. How awesome right?

Quick and tasty bite! YUMM!
author: Mia L.

description: Thick crust, it's of gooey cheese and a healthy portion of toppings. Great for a quick bite when you're starving. You guys are life savers
author: Richard C.

description: The menu language is different.  A pie does not mean a pie literally but a pie size pizza in a pizza box.  Because of a recent incident with some bad guys trying to rip the place (misuse of their martial arts), the behind counter is manned by tough guys.  Whadda pie pizza, last for a week.  I feel the defense all around me while I was waiting for my order.  I feel very safe.
author: BanBan T.

description:
Pizza was delicious! Had the pesto & cheese one. 
Slices are pretty big.

Service was good. 
Price was a little high if I remember... 

Overall great pizza place!
author: Kim W.

description: The pesto is reliable, the service is great, don't be a drunken knucklehead and you'll get along fine with the crew. I've had dozens of slices here over the years and will keep coming back as long as they stay this good.
author: Brian C.

description: Delivery is fast, easy to deal with and the Pizza is pretty good for the price. 25 bucks for a large pizza is not bad nowadays.
author: Q W.

description: While eating our way through Chinatown & north beach, this place smelled so good, it practicly said "Come in."  The guys here are very friendly & the pie is some of the best in the city with thin crispy crust.  The atmosphere is clean with a wooden floor & furniture with TVs with games going.  We all loved our slices, my cousin getting the Hawaiian & her friend & I getting the pesto delight with nutty creamy pesto sauce, tomatos, & feta cheese; you can bet we will stop the next time we are in the area.  So, for made top order pies at reasonable prices with friendly service in a casual atmosphere, Nazario's cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.
author: Brian S.

description:
Not as good as I expected. The crust was delicious but not enough toppings and the sauce was MIA.

The guy behind the counter was not very friendly either but service was prompt. Later I watched him eating the meat from the display case that had fallen off of a few pies. He proceeded to move some slices around without washing his hands.
author: Jeff B.

description:
Expectations were low as we walked into Nizario's for a slice during a post-work bar hop but I was pleasantly surprised. The slices here are pretty good. 

Granted I just needed a booze mop before the next bar but it was a pretty tasty mop. Ordered a peperoni slice that was fresh out of the oven... nice and toasty. While the pizza isn't Tony's good, you do get a pretty big slice for around the $3-ish mark and considering how fast service was, it's the perfect place for a pit-stop without heightened expectations.

Stop by the Broadway-Columbus intersection if you need decent grab-and-go nosh so you can continue your drinking expeditions.
author: Jon L.

description:
This isn't bad pizza, nor is it amazing pizza. It is one of those places you hit up because you don't know where else to go. But I did like that their crust was chewy on the inside. They have good pizza sauce as well. Prices are pretty cheap for slices, Cheese $2.50, pesto $3 and so on. They take credit and cash. 

No bells or whistles here. Just pizza and out you go.
author: Michelle M.

description: Pizza is decent, quick (for slices) and convenient. Nothing special but a great place for a quick hunger fix or late night. I was in town alone for work and just wanted something satisfying to take to my hotel room. This did the trick.
author: Heidi S.

description:
We went here for a quick lunch.

i ordered a pepperoni slice and a veggie slice.  Bother were very good.  I enjoyed the crust.  It is not a place to go out of your way to visit.  But if you are on Columbus and want a quick slice, Nizario's will do the trick.
author: Mark D.

description: My favorite pizza place. The guy makes a great pizza. Great place to hang out with some friends at night.
author: Peter N.

description: Yep, thats pizza. Good size slices, taste good. Nothing special but not bad either. Good service, they waived the 6 dollar minimum card fee and made sure they had enough pizza made as soon as they saw
author: Conor S.

description:
one of the better places to be drunk and eat pizza / satisfy drunchies

and then one day i came here sober, and it was still good!  mind blown.

so i guess it really is pretty good??
author: Jennifer L.

description: Came here after a long night of drinks. I bought a whole pie for my 2 friends and I to share. It was pretty delicious and was an essential buffer for all the alcohol in my GI tract/circulatory system. I poured lots and lots of parmesan cheese on my friend's pizza slice.
author: Marlon T.

description:
For being such a small place, they crank out some pretty good quality pizza (either by the slice, or a whole pie).  It's not so much that their flavor combinations are so extraordinary, but in my opinion, their crust is pretty exceptional.  Their crust is flavorful and crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside and not greasy at all.  

Although, there have been occasions where I've ordered a whole pie and the crust hasn't been crunchy enough (at least for my preference).  What I do when this happens is just pop it into my own oven for a little longer, to crisp it up even more.    

Now when you're ordering an individual slice, they normally heat up the slice by putting it in their oven where your slice takes a short little ride on the oven's conveyor belt.  Sometimes though, they give you a slice right out of the glass case because they "just made it and it's still warm", but believe me, it's worth waiting a little longer, for a crisper crust and goozey cheese, so just ask them to heat it up in the oven for you.

I normally get the Nizario's combination.  It's the general crowd pleaser because it has all the ingredients you would get on your average deluxe pizza (i.e. pepperoni, sausage, green bell peppers, and onions, etc).  

If you're short on time and want some solidly good pizza fast, this is a good place to go.
author: Danielle O.

description: I came here with my sister at about 1am on a Tuesday night and discovered that the shop was pretty much empty. My sister ordered a slice of their California pizza while I ordered a slice of their Pesto pizza, which came out to $8 for 2 slices. I would've given Nizario's 2 stars because the pizza was just "meh" and undercooked, but the employee actually attempted to made a fresh California and Pesto pizza since they didn't have any on hand. Would I be back? Probably not.
author: Joyce E.

description:
I love the one in the Richmond, so I was hoping this place would be just as good. Obviously from the rating, it was. 

Came here on St. Patrick's Day after the clubs were out. The place was messy, but it's a bit expected from the traffic they must have gotten throughout the night. The place wasn't too packed, but they got their pizzas ready to be served. 
I got the California: chicken, pesto, spinach and feta cheese. They gave me a big ol' slice for $4, that I didn't finish the crust. It was pretty good, rather sweet too.

There are other good pizza places around, but it was good to know that the Nizario's in North Beach is good too.
author: Mandy D.

description:
Oh Nizario, where the hell were you in my club/bar hopping hey days at North Beach.  At least you're here now.  At least I don't have to go to the inner Richmond to have a spectacular bite to eat after a debaucherous night out anymore.  Not to say that the inner Richmond doesn't have great bars; they just don't have nice clubs.  I just like dressing up and seeing people dressed up.

The pizza here is freaking AWESOME.  It taste even better when you're drunk.  Of course, don't give a slice to your boy whose had to much to eat or the girl you brought who can't hold much in her belly.  Experience has shown me that they'll be curbside soon enough.  Wait a bit and their stomachs should be available for slices of heaven.  BTW, I say curbside because the sole bathroom here seems to be occupied all the time.  The sign on the door says, "For Customers Only," but that never stops anyone, especially since the guys that work at this Nizario's are pretty stand up guys.  You can BS with them and do drunk antics and they're pretty understanding.  Just don't fight or do any rough housing that could damage property!  The bathroom, anyhow, is not desirable.  No matter...get your freak on (literally and figuratively) at the club or restaurant you were suppose to go to.  Don't disturb my alone time with my slice of pie, young'uns!
author: Jules S.

description: Why is this place not 5 stars? Clearly people are showing up without taste buds because this place is off the hook. Tried all their pizzas and they are all great.
author: Saul L.

description: A subpar slice under a heat lamp in a dingy environment. Fine if you are 21 years old and inebriated. Alas, I was 33 and sober.
author: Andrew K.

description: Yum!  And sorry to the previous reviewer, but I L-O-V-E the thick crust.  It's tasty.  I just wish they were open earlier for lunch every day!
author: Andrew S.

description:
I had a slice of the California......Chicken, pesto,feta and spinach.
Did i mention it was fresh out the oven???
SUPER DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!!! $4 FOR A SLICE AND THE SERVICE WAS GREAT.
author: Karen K.

description:
If you desire the absolute worst pizza in North Beach in the worst atmosphere with the worst customer service at filthy tables this is the place for you. I went here on a Monday night and ordered a combination slice. I understand that it would be cold but this is why it should be put in the oven for a minute. No sooner then did I pay for my slice was my pizza given to me. I found a seat near the back of the restaurant but no sooner than did I sit down then did I have to go back to the register where they keep a close eye on the napkins that they give out so that I may clean off my table. Further more there were only one set of cheese and peppershakers in the entire restaurant that I had to hunt down.

I tried enjoying my cold slice of pizza but all they had to watch on the TV was Spanish soap operas. This is a Pizza parlor on Monday night, where is the game? Also there was a sign on the women's restroom that said out of order, sorry ladies. If I could give this place zero stars I would. I'll never go back. $4.00 for the slice.
author: Justin S.

description:
Stopped in here for a couple slices of pepperoni ($8.50) and neither of us found them to be particularly good. It's a typical pizza-by-the-slice setting and we ordered at the counter and then ended up taking our food to go, and headed back to the car. 

The pizza place was clean, the employee that helped us was friendly, but the sauce didn't have much flavor and I wasn't a big fan of the crust.
author: Amy S.

description:
I left Grant and Green and was making my way towards BART. I walked a couple of blocks and realized I was still buzzing from their $1 Black Star beer. I had to find pizza, QUICK!

I found Nizario's and went in since they sell pizza by the slice. I looked at their selection and knew that everything was going to be ok. 

I got a slice of the California Pizza. It is a pesto pizza with chicken and spinach and cheese. It had a good crust. It wasn't greasy or flimsy. It was just delicious. The perfect complement to the beer. 

Slices are $4
There is a $7 ATM/visa min
author: Daisy S.

description: Ordered the Nizarios special -- basically a pizza supreme (pepperoni, mushrooms, onions, sausage, green peppers). It was good; a chewy dominos-style crust with lots of toppings. Definitely a decent pizza for most pizza-occasions, although I wouldn't choose it if I were looking for a classic NYC style pizza.
author: Anastacia S.

description:
OK Pizza Place in North Beach.

I've gone here several times for Pizza by the Slice.
Sometimes, especially late nights, the pizza has been sitting around and isn't as fresh as it should be.
author: Ayall S.

description: We have had late night pizza here two nights.  The slices are hot (the guys I was with had pepporoni and I had chicken and spinich... so good).  The variety is good for slices.  It is small but has all it needs.  YUM!
author: Lyndsey C.

description: Came here today, got a slice of pesto and a slice of veggie from the order-by-the-slice rotating turnstile. I loaded them up with crushed red pepper and parmesan cheese, and the veggie was actually pretty decent (I'd give it 4/5). It was pretty thick, had a lot of veggies, and was what I was looking for. The pesto pizza was not as good, it had pesto for the sauce and tomatoes on top. The flavor just didn't work as well, and I wish I'd gotten two slices of veggie. For $4 a slice, I think this place is a-ok but nothing better.
author: Amaresh S.

description: One of our family's fav pizza spots in SF. The pizza is always fresh and the staff/owned are always pleasant.
author: Mona L.

description:
Grabbed a slice on the way home after a night out in San Francisco.
Very big positive being open late and extremely affordable.
Hit the spot perfectly!
author: Patrick T.

description:
At 2am and you're spinning from all the Qream you've been tossing down, three bucks is a pittance to pay to get unslanted.

If you wanna go to the nicea sitta downa Ristorante Italiano, that's your business, but you can tell that this is not that place before you set your drunk foot in the door.

Three bucks for a big slice o' pepperoni.  Four for chicken pesto.  They serve a thick crust, not wafer thin.  Which, at 2am, is probably better for your constitution anyway.

The guys who work here are all very nice and way more congenial than I would be if I dealt with drunks all night long.
author: Ryan P.

description:
I'm not sure what I can really say about this place other than the fact I really like the pizza here.

Crust is crunchy with lots of toppings, nice and toasty cause they either have it freshly baked or they bake it for you on the spot with a bit of a wait time but well worth it.

Phils Picks..

-Nizarios Special
-California Special
-Vegetarian
-San Francisco Special

Yea that is like pretty much half the menu and if i could I would order all 4 at once for one meal but i would get fat and I really don't want that..
author: phillip w.

description:
If you're in need of a quick fix, this is the place to be...unless you need another kind of quick fix.  You can walk to Broadway for that.  

I was happy to receive great service and tasty slices of pizza while not having to wait in line for so long.  It was an extra plus that they accept cards!  There was a special on cheese slices, so that was suddenly what I was craving.

Although it's not the best slice I've ever had, it was definitely solid.  I'd rather go here than one of the touristy spots known for mistreating people.  It was fun to grab my pizza, walk to the park and watch dogs chasing after Frisbees near an old Asian couple holding hands.  They probably thought it was strange that I was staring at them while stuffing my face...
author: Jay P.

description:
After bar hopping around the North Beach area last Friday, my girlfriends and I decided to make a visit to Nizario's. While unsuccessfully trying to get a taxi, we happened to be standing on the corner of Nizario's and my two friends decided to go in and seek shelter from the cold weather and get some grub.

The pizza here is great - inexpensive, large slices of yummy, tasty pizza. Yes, I was drunk while scarfing down my slice of Mushroom Cheese pizza - but that doesn't mean I can't tell the difference between something that tastes bad, okay, or great. Pizza here is great for $3-$4, and yeah it hits the spot like crazy when you're under the influence. However, I think I'll be back regardless of time or day or occasion when I'm craving a slice.
author: Tiffany K.

description: Just ate a couple slices of a vegetarian pizza. It was fresh, but lacking depth... discovered it was the almost absent marinara sauce. Come on, guys - the sauce is what makes the pie!
author: MTeresa W.

description: I love the pizza here. Whenever I feel like splurging I get the Nizarios Special. I bring family from out of town here and they love it. They lose one star because sometimes the delivery guy picks and chooses where they will deliver to in the city.
author: Michelle L.

description:
OH. MY. GOD

MOUTHGASM AFTER MOUTHGAZM. 

I can't wait to go back!! Maybe it's because I was drunk but dear lord this pizza is amazing. I salivate just thinking about it. Screw the clubs, I'd rather get this pizza.
author: Laura W.

description: While in the city 2 weeks ago we reviewed and went to a small thin crust place in North Beach...pizza wasn't bad. But was still hungry and on vacation after all and strolled into this place....what a great slice of pizza! Friendly staff too!
author: Jon U.

description:
Bought the slice of cheese pizza here late night...honestly, taste and texture was exactly like the new Domino's pizza.

Nothing wrong with that, I just expect a big more. Big slice, decent value, but just not amazing pizza.

Must be the east coast in me....
author: Jon R.

description:
Ehhhhh not the best but not the worst.

I don't know if it's a good thing or a bad thing, but I don't think there has ever been a time I've popped in here and had there be a single other customer there.   I mean, it's great because I get my slices right away.  But it's bad because, well, I want my pizza joint PACKED because it's so good (a la Little Star).

Major props for having a Mushroom Slice available.  Boo for me not being able to find a single WHOLE mushroom slice.  All were pulverized.  But it still had mushroomy goodness.

Will definitely pop in from time to time.  But not a rush over, must go to kind of place.
author: Chelsea C.

description:
I think 3-stars is just about the perfect rating for this place.  Indeed, being open late is a HUGE bonus -- nothing like getting to hang out and not having clock-watch for fear  you won't be able to find anything to eat after 9pm.

This is the kind of place where if you find it unexpectedly (especially thinking nothing will be open) you're pretty happy.

However, a group of friends and I have been making it a regular destination after our outings and I've begun to realize the pizza here is just is not very good.

It's kind of like emergency back-up pizza.  The cheese is... well let's just say that it's only recently that I found out some pizza joints use fake cheese and I'm beginning to think that this is one of them.

Still, I'm glad they exist.  But if you want to really good eats -rather than merely functional - it's better to shop around.

PS: I should add that I'm hardly a "foodie" and tend to be easily satisfied.  And yet.
author: Kate J.

description:
My whole night was fuzzy on Saturday night, but the California pizza brought me back to reality. Mmmm, spinach, pesto, and chicken goodness.

I hope to return one day when I am NOT drunk.
author: Emily T.

description:
This place lost stars not only because the pizza was mediocre, but also because the service was bad and it was overall and awkward experience.

A friend and I stopped in after a night of bar hopping to get a few slices before moving on with our night. I ordered some pizza and the cashier charged me $80 instead of $8. You can imagined how thrilled I was, especially since he was extremely high. He just kind of ignored me when I asked him what had happened and then he started getting really nervous so someone else had to come over and correct it for me. It took a week for them to credit back the $72 that I did not spend pizza on.

On top of it all, the pizza wasn't even any good.
author: Denise S.

description:
Cheap pizza, but pretty good quality, much better than the junk they're peddling in Russian Hill. 

The only downside, there's so many people coming in there drunk and yelling about strippers since the place is surrounded by strip joints. If you dont mind eating next to six guys sitting in wifebeaters sporting fake ice talking about the virtues of heavily tattooed strippers, then have a try.
author: Ash S.

description:
Overall (6/10)
Food (7/10)
location (9/10) - walking distance from all the fun
price (8/10)

I've been here twice, and both times at 2-3am and slightly happy.  Pizza was okay, definitely a step above the chains, but not something to write home about.  Food check, late night check, price is right check.  All in all a worthy experience.  4 stars are for places I would go just to eat there, this place is convenient and tasty.  =)

Would I come back? yessir.  Need a drink or two so I can find it again.  I'm not sure if I can find it sober and during the day time.
author: Andrew A.

description:
Great pizza, affordable price, I got a medium for 16 dollars. 

Cons: The bath was disgusting.
author: Miguel F.

description: This is definitely a place to grab a slice when in need of a bite on Columbus. The staff was friendly and the pizza was warm and tasty, but the location lacks an enjoyable atmosphere. It wasn't even 10 PM and we were surrounded by rowdy party-goers. It was a great place to stop, but we were ready to leave as soon as we finished eating.
author: Sophia A.

description:
Four stars for being open until 2am alone. In SF, not as much stuff is open late as you'd think! I guess it makes sense in this neighborhood, though haha.

Pretty decent pizza, I liked the crust, and the guy in the front was friendly. 

Nothing like a late - night slice of pizza amongst the bright, flashy lights of North Beach on a rainy night.
author: Angela S.

description: Jesus Christ this was good and the staff was amazing! It was even better cold the next day. I travel alot and this is easily one of the best pizzas ive come across. Def putting on my to do list anytime I co.e back to S.F.!
author: Le J.

description:
Fast.  That is the best thing about this place.

The slice of mushroom was reasonably good.  The slice of veggie is a little disgusting.
author: Niniane W.

description:
I'm an East Coaster, and I know that a lot of the pizza around here, even in North Beach, is barely adequate.  So it's nice to find a place that gets the idea of non-Sicilian pizza right.

The place is a little sparse (at least the times I've been there), and it's got an awkward arrangement.  But the slices make up for it:  The crust is excellent (puffy, not "rustic" flaky, and a nice crunch), the sauce is solid, and the cheese is pretty good.  I can't say much for toppings (I'm not much of a toppings person for my pizza), but on the most basic level, the slice is good.  Which is enough for me.
author: Sean B.

description: The pictures look really good. The prices are pretty inexpensive. And the pizza that arrived delivery looked very good too. It just doesn't taste great. The sauce is kinda weak. The toppings like the sausage taste like fast food pizza toppings. But the clincher for me is the crust. It has a fast food or frozen pizza quality to it. It's not greasy, it's not terrible, it's just not a great pizza crust.
author: Adam M.

description: Delicious pizza. They also deliver pretty much anywhere in the city. The veggie is bomb.com.
author: Lauren D.

description:
Gosh! I so want to give this 5 starts, should i feel guilty that i have rated other pizza places 5 stars and that's why I am only giving Nizario's 4?? Because i do!!!

This pie is GREAT!!!!! Hmm wait  a minute..I am usually pretty tossed while eating Nizario's, could this be fogging my judgment? Maybe a little bit, i will admit GoldenBoy is way better, but this is still a great pizza.  The crust i is my favorite part, it is always fast, the food is hot and it has great flavor, what else could you ask for after a night of drinkin.

It is cheap, fast, and taste good, give it a try!
author: Skyler W.

description:
There is still no good pizza in San Francisco, but this was somewhat bearable.  All I want is some damn New York style!

This joint looks like a taqueria inside and though large, strangely only has a few tables.

I don't like that they keep their slices in a warmer...they should keep it out and then put it in the super hot oven again to melt the cheese, that is just the way it is done.  Anyway, if it were really good pizza, they wouldn't need to keep it warm because people would be banging down the door to eat it.

I don't know, San Francisco pizza is San Francisco pizza; it's a huge let down after living my whole life on the East Coast.  I am sure you inexperienced SFers will love it, so go ahead, enjoy.
author: Caitlin H.

description: Crisp crust, generous toppings, every bit as good as their Geary counterpart.  With more seating.
author: Meg W.

description:
Man, I thought I already yelped these guys!

I love this place. Always get the tiajuana pizza : pepperoni, pineapple and jalapeno. Its amazing.

And the guy who answers the phone when I call for delivery is always SO FREAKING NICE. I actually had to tell my boyfriend how incredibly impressed I was, because really. Every time. Hes great. 

Thanks Nizarios!
author: Britney K.

description:
The perfect pesto pizza slice. I'm usually one for NY slice, but nizario's puffy toasty grease ball of a slice hooked me hard, and i've been back for more too many times to count.

Grab that slice and sling that cozy spot in Jack Kerouac alley, leaning right up against City Lights Books, wild eyed, happy and hungry after a night of boozing the streets of North Beach. Plate stashed between steel toed knees up high hiding face, dig in. 

Marvel the other bums fueled on smoke and wine, and grin slyly at the bourgies who go by sizing up the happy street kid digging into a much needed staple of greased up nutrition.

only way to eat nizario's north beach in my books.
author: Mal S.

description: I have only had one pizza slice from this place and I must say that I am an instant fan. Nizario's Pizza is pretty darn excellent. Maybe I'm just easy to please, but I thoroughly enjoyed that slice. Let me back up and say that we had a few drinks in us by this point and food probably tastes better after you've been drinking. Still, it's a great choice, especially when it's late and you just want something quick.
author: Paolo D.

description: Such a yummy slice of vegetarian pizza. Plus I got to let my beaner out with the dude behind the counter.
author: Monica H.

description:
Not amazing.

But perfect for a late night on Broadway.  So many selections by the slice.  And a restroom for customers...  This is my drunk snack spot for sure.  Numero uno for drunken Broadway nights.
author: Lauren R.

description: This has been the best pizza in San Francisco so far!. I came in at 11pm on a Friday and the pizza was fresh, not like many other places where the dough tastes like it's been sitting there for hours. This pizza was crispy on the edges and soft on the inside with enough chesse and sauce, perfect! Try the pepperoni one! Me and my BF spent only 8$ for 2 pizzaa and a coke. The best deal!
author: Ibelig V.

description:
Cheap, fast, PERFECT (after a night at the club/bar scene in North Beach).

This is definitely our number one place to go after a night of drinking in the area. The pizza is good, though not necessarily the BEST I've had. But I highly recommend it! And at $3.50-$4 per slice, you can't really go wrong. Amazing places like this is why overpriced chains like Sbarro are filing for bankruptcy!
author: Brad Y.

description:
Tasty. Cheap. Six minutes from school. Always playing hip hop videos on the TV. 

....and that's my review.
author: Aaron Z.

description:
Apparently I'm not picky enough, or I'm faded and just don't care. Either way, their pizza rocks. Its piping hot, has plenty of toppings, and the sauce is nice and zesty. What more could you ask for?

Yea, the tables are crusty and theres never enough seating, but thats the least of my worries when the food is so orgasmically awesome.
author: leland k.

description: We had been drinking, we were starving, so we got the last two slices of pizza from this place and were happily surprised by how good these sketchy-ass slices of pizza were. I had no idea it was a chain. No idea it was even a thing-- just sorta thought it was the standard end to a night of bar hopping and strip club attending... which is probably true. I'm down.
author: Jessie M.

description:
It's awesome that this place is open after the clubs close so drunk people can get some food and water in their stomachs. Helps prevent a bad hangover. Good pizza, I think it was $3 a slice. 

Watch for douchebags.
author: Chris I.

description:
I've grabbed slices here a couple of times.  The crust is kind of light, a little puffy and thick but crisp on the bottom.  Satisfactory sauce tops the slices adequately.  Not bad at all.

Too bad they ruin it with lousy tasting toppings and cheese that has the texture of wax paper.
author: Suo L.

description:
Really yummy pizza! (Then again, I don't think I've eaten here sober so that might amplify my praise a little) Reasonable prices and good portions.

I love that they are open late!
author: Keli B.

description: Great pizza. Perfect amount of sauce and cheese. I had a basic sausage pizza and it was great. The crust is fantastic. They also deliver, which is amazing.
author: Jessica M.

description: Dropped in to grab a slice after hanging out at Cafe Trieste. Not my first choice in pizzerias but Golden Boy was closed. I got a slice of pesto pie to go but it was unflinchingly and apologetically greasy. Perhaps if I had gone with a meatier slice things might have turned out differently. As it stands, I do not have a high opinion of them and their oily pesto pizza.
author: Rebecca L.

description:
I moved to San Francisco just over a year ago and since then, there have been three different food spots occupying this busy corner of Broadway and Columbus.  First chicken, then Mexican, and now pizza.  I hope Nizario's is here to stay!

It's a local chain, with other locations in the Castro and the Richmond district.  Location is convenient and open until 2 am seven days a week.  Decor is basic, but clean and comfortable with seating in the back.  Guys working the counter were super friendly, fast, and efficient.

But most importantly - the pizza...it's solid!  As a New Yorker, I have high standards for pizza and this is in the top 5 slices I've had in SF.  Crust is fairly thick and bubbly with a light dusting of cornmeal at the bottom, with a nice ratio of sauce to cheese to crust.  I liked it!  I think this will be my new go-to spot for a quick bite on the way home from work.  Yum...
author: Jaimie M.

description:
Cheap pizza? Decent? Okay!

Golden Boy is way better though and either the same price or only 25 cents more.
author: Jen N.

description:
I pumped up that Nizario's opened in North Beach.  It's a nice alternative to North Beach Pizza.

5 stars for my delivery order tonight.  Service over the phone was great, food was delivered promptly (30 mins on a Sat night), and the pizza was fantastic - great crust, cheese and toppings.
author: Raja B.

description: meh. better than the big chains. a typical American slice. not crispy. no epic sauce. just good/ok.
author: Noah F.

description: Stopped here on our North Beach Pub Crawl for a little Snackie Snack. I ordered a Combination Slice and my Friend ordered a Peperoni slice . These are thin crust slices . Not to bad my Combo slice had a lot of toppings on it Taste was average . Cost  for a Combo Slice was $4.
author: Eugene L.

description: If your looking for a late night slice of cheap pizza, look no further! Cheese slice is delicious
author: Alvin R.

description: The pizza is amazing!! And the younger dude at the counter is awesome!! Super friendly, fast and delicious! I recommend any pizza with pesto on it!!!
author: Kitty P.

description:
The pesto pizza was the only thin I tried, but it was AMAZING.  the people in here were super-friendly and made me a fresh pizza when the guy in front of me took the last piece of pesto pizza before I could order.  

The interior is kind of sparse, but when you are paying about $3 for a slice of pizza you aren't exactly looking for high-class ambiance. 

Open late, so you can get a slice after having some drinks!
author: Miss L.

description:
this place sucked. they could only sell the pizzas that were premade. they couldnt even add ONE topping! WTF.

i was drunk and the pizza that they did have wasnt bad tho (hence the extra star.)
author: Lisa N.

description:
Standard fare. california and veggie options are good.

The only reason to go to this place is its open at odd hours and has home delivery plus its right outside my house.
author: Utsav M.

description: Came here after we came all the way from Alameda and realized our favorite Bakery was closed for vacation. The Nizario's Special pizza was really fresh and good. The bell peppers were crunchy! yum! However, I thought the crust was too thick for my liking. However, some people might like that! :) The people here are really friendly and a joy to be around!
author: Katrina L.

description: this little pizza joint is on a busy corner and has pizza by the slice plenty room to sit and watch the game on TV I ate here 2 times in the week I stayed in Frisco
author: David W.

description: Traveled to San Francisco (Thanksgiving Eve), arrived late, no restaurants open ... except Nizario's.  I ordered a slice of Cheese and Supreme and even though the pizza was more than likely placed out all day, it was was absolutely tasty!  Very casual atmosphere (nothing to write home about), not to mention there's a questionable neighborhood feel to it.  Regardless, the prices are very affordable, just a little "hole in the wall" pizza place, but you will definitely leave satisfied...
author: Isaac G.

description:
This is not thin crust gourmet pizza, nor is it crunchy foccacia-style crust gourmet pizza.

This is more like Domino's or Sbarro's puffy- and doughy-crust pizza, but tastier. And the price is right at $3-4 per slice.
author: Rob T.

description: Cheese slice is serviceable if you're in a pinch, but overall their pizza is pretty nasty.  It's open late, which is nice.
author: Juan R.

description: Decent pizza at a good price.  They're open really late...and out of all the cheaper pizza places in the neighborhood...they have the best crust!
author: Mreant M.

description: Average pizza. Pretty good when it's fresh out of the oven, but they usually make you choose whatever is left in the display case. About $3.50 for a slice of pepperoni pizza, and they also have more seating than the one off Geary. A good spot to hit up after a night of bar hopping in North Beach!
author: Aeramis F.

description: I think I ordered the wrong slice.  It was okay, not great... we went to Pizzelle across the street for our second slices.
author: Erika C.

description: I was in the neighborhood with a friend. The original plan was to grab coffee and a pastry at a cafe but we ended up getting a bit lost and Nizario's was right on the corner so we stopped buy. Small place, really nice servers. I got a slice of California pizza (pesto, chicken). It was pretty damn delicious! Large and full of flavor and not too greasy. no complaints :D
author: Wanda M.

description: Great place to go when you stumble out of the bar and not much else is open. Even when other stuff is open this is still a good place to head. So...I dont think you necessarily have to be drunk to enjoy this. 2 slices will fill you up if you have a big appetite.
author: Alfredo R.

description: Super greasy pizza but not the worst slice in North Beach. Still this place doesn't really have anything going for it. The interior is bland and feels like a dorm.
author: Michael H.

description:
Definitely a kind of janky store and sitting place (it's pretty dark, but who needs lights to eat), but the pizza is heavenly. Nice thick crust. Where other places (in my experience) only put pesto on their pesto pizza, there is also a layer of tomato sauce on these savory pies.
 
It certainly fills a hearty appetite after climbing up to the Coit Tower on the Filbert Steps or after a morning of reading in City Lights (a neighboring store).
author: Vivian W.

description: great pizza and customer service!!! we would come back. they just have dirty bathrooms
author: Noelle M.

description: I LOVE getting Nizaro's pizza after the club! It's so friggin' gooooood, and cheap ($4/slice)! California Special is the best! It has pesto, spinach, chicken and feta cheese. Get itttttt, so good!
author: Natalie O.

description: I was just looking for a slice of pizza after a night of comedy and drinks and I end up finding some of the best pizza I have had in San Francisco. The slice was thin but not super thin. The toppings were fresh and the sauce tasted great.. All at a reasonably price.
author: Justin C.

description: Place was empty. They didn't have any slices. I guess they sold out of everything. Guy said there's a pizza coming out in 10mins. Sat in the large dining room. Picked up a slice when done. Dough was still doughy, and cheese was luke warm, you can obviously tell the cheese wasn't melted all the way yet. Hated that the sausage wasn't sausage but the perfectly round sausage you get on frozen pizzas. After the 3 bites gave it to my drunk friend who was mad hungry. I've been to the geary location in the past, it didn't taste like this before.
author: Robin L.

description: We love their pizza. Everyone has their own idea of the perfect slice and two people will hardly ever agree but this place is clean, the food is fresh and the pizza is not greasy. The sauce has a good flavor and the toppings are a plenty.
author: E S.

description: Now WOW , now that's pizza, baby! After a night trying to balance yourself in some super tall heels in heights comparable to the shoes of many of the young ladies employed in certain show businesses here, you neeeeed a break from walking, and maybe something to eat too. Conveniently slapped dabbed on the corner is Nizaro's Pizza..... YUM. To be honest, I didn't expect this place to have such good pizza, nor be close to clean. Surprisingly they've got that perfect crust, soft yet a little crispy at the same time. The cheese was just the right amount, and the toppings were top top baby! Mmmm I'm getting hungry thinking about the pizza here.  The guys that work here are super friendly too, they don't rush you into deciding what you want. They also say thank you when you leave (which I noticed saying thank you after eating and leaving is becoming rare these days!). The price of a slice depends on what you get, make sure you have at least $4 ready to spend for a slice, but it's extremely worth it. This is definitely going to be a go-to place when I'm in the area.
author: Monina C.

description: The pizza was good. We were looking for lunch on our first day in SF. Something quick, kids were hungry. Our pizza was made fresh for us. Service was good. Sodas were nice and cold. Price is good, large pizza, 4 sodas, $23 with tax.
author: Jamie M.

description:
iono man, when i bought a sliced combo, it wasn't all that great. the crust was pretty hard. it was pre-made hours ago, and then the dude stuck it in the oven for like 10 seconds and gave it to me. It was obviously not hot or warm...eating cold pizza is never good. 

i mean all of the toppings are there for a combo pizza, but it lacks flavor. Defintely not fresh. the slice is kinda small. It's not NASTY, but it's not good either. for 4.50, the quality is not there. not going there again.
author: Theo T.

description: I stopped by after work on my walk home. For some reason their crust is just very delicious. It has the perfect balance of crispness and subtle flavor. I liked it more than I expected.
author: Kathleen T.

description:
giant slices at good prices served hot & fast; the California is my fave: pesto and good-sized chunks of white-meat chicken.

YUM!
author: Steven T.

description: I really love their slice of chicken pesto pizza! The feta cheese just dances on your tongue! I also adore their over sized tables and chairs--just like something out of Alice in Wonderland.
author: Robert T.

description: Yum!!  I got a slice of their pesto  and it was delicious!  The dough is kind of thick, perfectly crispy on the bottom and soft and fluffy in the middle.  It's the kind of crispy that remains crispy no matter how slow you eat too. The only thing I would change  is that next time I will order a freshly cooked large pizza.  Can't wait!!
author: hanh b.

description: The only place in the area that would deliver after 10pm on a Sunday. That alone deserves 4 stars. When you're hungry and desperate, call nizarios! The pizza is pretty good too.
author: Nes L.

description: Well this is my first review so here it goes.. I have passed by nizario's on columbus several times and i finally decieded to try it. I headed out there on my lunch break and got a slice of mushroom i thought $3 not bad. It's not unitl i got my slice that i realized it was a rip off. The slice was so tiny!! not very cheesey as i like it and it tasted kinda old like its been sitting there for hours. would not recomend this place unless maybe you buy the pie and its fresher. The Nizario's on arguello is better.
author: Brigitte G.

description: stopped to get a slice after doing some wine tasting @ Impala Lounge. best pizza by the slice i've ever had!! sooooooo freakin good, i'm craving it right now!
author: rita s.
